Key:
(A sudden attack... I had a sense that something was
off, but I couldn't put my finger on it.)

(The city I saw shouldn't have been any different.
It was the usual scenery. The path I was used to
taking.)

(But I wonder why... it seemed like something was
missing.)

(Then again, this wasn't the first time I felt this
way. For the feeling to hit me while things were
relatively peaceful was a strange thought, indeed.)

(I don't know what that feeling is, but I'm sure that
something's missing here.)

(Despite not having any evidence to back it up, even
though it was illogical... Deep down, I was certain.)
*Sigh*...

What's the matter, Onii-chan? Why did you sigh out
of the blue?

Huh? Ah, no... I was just... wondering what to make
for dinner.

(I tried to play it off as I plated our breakfast and
put it on the dining table.)
Your worries are so innocent～
What do you mean by that?!
You're you, Onii-chan!

That makes no sense! ...Not that it's a big deal or
anything.

Aww, got it～ But if you feel sick, be sure to rest,
okay?
Got it. Thanks for worrying about me.
Hehehe. I am your dependable little sister, after all.
Yes, I am always depending on you, Imouto-sama.
Hehehe. Leave it to me～
Well, let's just eat breakfast. Come on, it's ready.
Okaaaay.
Thanks for the meal!
Huh...? Onii-chan. Thank you for the meal～
Whoa?! Wh-What are you doing, Kotori?!
Right back at you. It's not a big deal," my ass.
*Grunt*... Sorry.

...So? What happened? If you're stressed about
something, just tell me about it.

Hmmm... I know you're just going to think I'm crazy,
but...
Stop it with the disclaimers and just tell me already.

Oh. Well... there was someone besides me who used
to make breakfast... right?

Obviously. Like mom and me. And the times when
Tohka and the others helped. Even Maria cooked for
us the other day.

No, it's not that. That's not what I meant. I don't
know who it is, but I feel like there was someone else
who used to be in the kitchen a lot.
Huh? You don't know who it is... Are you crazy?
...I told you you'd think that...

I never said I wouldn't. But... What the hell, is this
some kind of scary story?
No. It's just... I felt like someone was here.
Hm... When was this?

When? Um... maybe... before we went into summer
break?

Huh? What are you talking about? If it's that recently,
there's no way that any of us would forget. I bet you
it's just some kind of summer fever dream.
You might be right...

...If you're really concerned about it, you could see
a counselor.

Oh, no. It's not that bad. I think I'm just out of it or
something.

I see. Well if you say so, Shido... Anyways, let's end
the dream talk here. If we keep hanging around, we'll
be late.
Right. Oh, you're right... I should hurry.

(Kotori's right. The only thing I have is this weird
sense inside me that something's off. I'm sure it's
just a continuation of my dream.)

(But... no matter how much I think that, once I
acknowledged this feeling, the fog in my heart
wouldn't go away.)
What is the matter, Shido? You seem a little down.

You clearly weren't focused in class. That must be
because of Tohka Yatogami. You should disappear
from Shido's surroundings immediately.
What?! Don't be a fool, Origami Tobiichi!

Hey, come on you guys, stop it! It's not a big deal.
I... was just thinking about a dream I had.
Dream? What kind of dream?

Hmm... I don't remember it in detail. I think it was a
dream about an ordinary day.

A dream about an ordinary day? Then that means
it's a dream of me being with you! That must be fun!

Ah, that's not exactly it... but I guess it's not wrong,
either.

How naïve. If you experience the same day every day,
you'll lack necessary stimulation. Shido, you need a
more intense life... You should come live with me.

Wait! Can you not say things that give people the
wrong impression?!

It's not a wrong impression. I'm just going off of your
desires.
Can you not talk as if I'm some huge pervert?!

Hey, did you hear?! Itsuka-kun is forcing Tobiichi-san
to be perverted again!

That's not all! He's also trying to spend the night with
Tohka-chan as well!

What a low-life! Seriously, what a turn off. It goes
against the ethics of modern youth!

Stop putting the blame on me! Seriously, it never ends
with you guys. Just cut it out!
Look who's talking! The nerve!

Every damn day, we have to watch you flirt! God, you
walking pervert!
Unforgivable. Seriously, beyond forgiving!
Yeah! Even if God forgives you, I won't!
You stay out of this!
Aww...!
Argh...

(Tohka and Origami are at odds again, and our
classmates are making a ruckus. The usual.)

(I wonder if I feel like something is missing here
because of my dream.)
(Hm? That person there...)

Yoshino, Kaguya, Yuzuru, and even Miku...? What an
odd combination.
Oh... Shido-san! Um, I was... um, out shopping...

(What Yoshino handed me was a plastic bag full of
fish. It seemed like there were all kinds in vibrant
colors.)

(...It looked really chaotic. There were even some
that looked like she fished them out of the deep sea.
Where did she buy these?)

Hehehe... You sure seem surprised, my slave. You are
witnessing the true power that dwells inside of us.
Um... So what are you trying to say?
Hehehe. Are you sure you wanna ask? You really\nwanna know? Shido-kun, you're going to get super\nturned on hearing what a bad girl Yoshino was today.
Y-Yoshinon...!

Hehehe. We were all shopping together, and
because we were so cute, the shop owner gave us
a lot of freebies～
Ugh, gosh... Bad Miku-chan! You can't just give away\nthe secret so easily!

Now, now, who cares... Darling would have figured it
out immediately. Right, darling?
Y-Yeah... But that sure is a lot...

(If these were mostly freebies, I'm kind of worried
about the store...)

Of course, it wasn't just Yoshino. Kaguya and Yuzuru
were there, so it's only natural that the owner would
give us freebies.
I see... Wait, is that supposed to convince me?
Um, Shido-san... Here...!
Oh, you're going to give this to me?

K-Knowing you... You'd make something delicious out
of it.
Oh, you're starting to sound like Tohka.
A-Ah...

We should use them while they're still fresh. Well,
why don't we have this as dinner, then? Let's all eat
together.
YAY! You're amazing, Shido-kun! So generous!

I'd be so happy to be with you and the others! I will
go no matter what!

Oh! That's a great idea! A holy supper from the deep
ocean god... Clearly fit for me.

Correction. Kaguya, there are river fish mixed in
there as well.

What?! I-It was only a figure of speech! I didn't make
a mistake, okay?!

Sad laugh. That's just an excuse that you couldn't
differentiate between the types of fish here. Pfft.
Rrgh! Yuzuru, you know what?!

Hahaha. What are you talking about... Anyways, I'm
going to rush home. What do you guys want to do?
Oh... I'm going to stop by my place first.
I see. Then I guess I can walk you home.
Oh, I know. Hey Shido-kun?
Hm? What is it?
Well, since she visits so often, don't you think you\nshould give Yoshino a spare key?
Y-Yoshinon...?!

Spare key, huh... Come to think of it, a spare key
would—
I———ake———of——t
...What was that?
Shido...san? What's the matter...?

N-Nothing. Spare key, huh... I may have an extra so
I'll look for it, okay?
Amazing, Shido-kun. You're so understanding!
S-Sorry, Shido-san...
No problem. I'll see you then?
Y-Yes! I'll visit later, okay...?
Sure. I'll be waiting.

(Is something happening? I can sense it. There's
something wrong with me today.)
(And besides, what was that...)

All right. I think I'm ready. I feel like I'm forgetting...
Oh, that's right. Yoshinon brought up the spare key.
I think it's around this shelf...
Huh, it's not here. I thought there was an extra one.
(Hmm... Not here, either.)
Then, is it in my room?

(When I got in the room, I had this feeling... that
the spare key would be in here.)

(Come to think of it, it'd be odd that a spare key
would be in my room. Because I'm always carrying
my own key around.)

(Well, no point in worrying about that now. Anyways,
I'll try this drawer.)

(There it is. A small bag at the back of the drawer.
The design was clearly not something I chose.)

(I was certain of it. That there would be a spare key
in here.)

Huh? Why did I think that? Not only that, but when did
I even make a spare?

...Wait, Kotori gave it to me. That's right. I just forgot...
There's nothing weird about it.

(As I predicted, there was a key inside the bag. Just
a key on its own, not decorated, no key ring.)
...I'll take good care of it.

(I definitely remembered something right now.
A voice I don't recognize. But it felt so nostalgic...
and the voice was so soft...)

(I squeezed the key tightly, and it made a dent in my
palm.)

(Along with the cold metal feeling of it, I also felt
a pang of pain go through my chest.)

(It felt like all the power in my body was quickly
leaving me. I kneeled slowly onto the floor.)

(My heart was pounding. It was similar to something
I remembered... I know, it was like when I used the Spirit's power...)
—*Grunt*... Aha...

(I felt a sensation like everything was being dragged
around me, then I felt my consciousness being
engulfed.)
I...forever, okay?
